abstract: 'A prisoner of war is not the most dignified way to live.'
description: Frank Cox signed up to joined the army to see what they had in store for him. He started work as a dispatch rider in Palestine and finished up in the Suez Canal as part of his training. After serving in Tobruk and Greece, Cox became a prisoner of war and has borne witness to the suffering of his colleagues.
